verbs.description: planish (third-person singular simple present planishes, present participle planishing, simple past and past participle planished)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To repeatedly hammer (a sheet of metal) so as to shape and smooth it or create a decorative indented finish.
examples: Although much of the copperwork done in school workshops is planished only once, many craftsmen planish their work three or four times in order to get a perfect finish.
